thread.title: Man United 0-0 Hull: Five things we learned as Mourinho's men fail to close gap on Chelsea
thread.title_full: Man United 0-0 Hull: Five things we learned as Mourinho's men fail to close gap on Chelsea

title: Man United 0-0 Hull: Five things we learned as Mourinho's men fail to close gap on Chelsea
text:
Man United 0-0 Hull: Five things we learned as Mourinho's men fail to close gap on Chelsea EXPRESS SPORT brings you five things we learned from Manchester United's 0-0 draw with Hull. PUBLISHED: 21:59, Wed, Feb 1, 2017 | UPDATED: 21:59, Wed, Feb 1, 2017 Paul Pogba 
Despite a slight improvement in recent months, Paul Pogba remains far from justifying his hefty transfer fee. 
And even a new haircut wasn't enough to inspire him this evening. 
He was unlucky to twice see a shot well saved by Hull goalkeeper Eldin Jakupovic but overall he failed to exert enough influence on the game. Man United fans reacts as Phil Jones limps off against Hull Wed, February 1, 2017 Express Sport brings you all the best tweets as Phil Jones limps off during Manchester United's clash with Hull Man Utd via Getty Images 1 of 10 Man United's Phil Jones limped off against Hull and this is how fans reacted Half time substitutions 
Manchester United were very poor in the first half and it was no surprise to see Jose Mourinho make a substitution at the interval. 
The Portuguese is never afraid to make changes and Wayne Rooney was called on to make the difference in place of Michael Carrick. 
In truth any United player in midfield and attack could have been taken off. Premature dancing 
Rio Ferdinand criticised Pogba and Jesse Lingard after the United duo posted a video of themselves performing a new dance celebration routine. 
The ex-United defender questioned the timing of the video with United currently sixth in the league. 
And his comments will have extra weight now after United's disappointing display. EPA Manchester United's Paul Pogba Anthony Martial 
The France international was bizarrely absent during United's pre-match warm-up yet he was able to take his place on the bench alongside the other substitutes. 
However Mourinho opted not to bring on the 21-year-old despite the lack of pace and creativity in his side. 
After an impressive debut season, Martial has failed to live up to expectations and his Old Trafford future is increasingly uncertain. Phil Jones 
The central-defender has been one of United's more impressive performers since working his way back into the team. 
But he came off in the second half with a muscle injury which will be a blow to Mourinho. 
However it will give a chance to Chris Smalling and Eric Bailly to reclaim their spot. Related articles
